creditline: Bequest from the Norman and Brenda Canedy Collection
description: A drawing of a group of male figures standing around a sacred tripod outside a classical temple; including priests and a man with an axe holding a sacrificial bull
inscription: Old mat inscription in graphite: see un basso rilievo le trovasi nel Museo Capitolino a Roma (?)\"
medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash over lead point on laid paper laid down
text: This drawing copies an ancient relief representing Marcus Aurelius (121-180 AD), Emperor of Rome, sacrificing a bulll before the Temple of Jupiter on the Capitoline. The relief is now in the Palazzo dei Conservatori, Musei Capitolini, Rome.
title: Sacrifice of Marcus Aurelius before the Temple of Jupiter on the Capitoline
